header.h1: Superintendent Update: School Closure - Week of March 30th!

span.content: Superintendent Update: School Closure - Week of March 30th!

div.p: Dear Parents, Families and School Community Members,
I wanted to reach out briefly on a few items, and also to take a moment to celebrate! First a few items of "Business"...
div.h3: Satellite Lunch Program - Operation Feed SEBRSD!
div.p: As everyone knows we are one of only a few local school districts west of Worcester providing Free Meals for ALL Students within the Spencer-East Brookfield Regional School District. The schedule for the week of April 3rd through 10th, 2020 ncludes the following locations and times.

ul.li: Mary Queen of the Rosary Church (Parking Lot) at 60 Maple Street
Richard Sugden Library (Rear of Building) at 8 Pleasant Street
East Brookfield Baptist Church (Parking Lot) at 262 East Main Street
9 Bixby Road Hosing Development – NEW LOCATION (This location is for residents only).

ol.li: Drive Up and Let us know how many meals you would like.
Staff will provide you with the appropriate number of meals.
Drive off and have a nutritious day!

p.strong: IMPORTANT: The “Grab and Go” Meals Program will not be in operation during the week of April Vacation, April 20 – 24. Please plan accordingly.

div.p: Faculty and staff will begin directing students at all grade levels and in each middle and high school course with weekly assignments beginning Monday, March 30. Please refer to SEBRSD's Remote Learning Website to view your students' specific school assigned learning opportunities each week. The site can be found on the Internet by searching seb-remote-learning. Addition suggestions for supporting students' remote learning can be viewed from our Student Services webpage or our Student Services information bulletin.

In addition to the weekly guided assignments, the following are some quick guidelines for continuing to learn and grow as a scholar during these weeks of school disruption. Many general resources are websites or other online tools that can be accessed from computers, mobile phones, tablets, online gaming systems (Xbox, Nintendo, ... etc). For some sites you will need your username and password to log in and use the resources, others are freely accessible to everyone. More resources are being brought forward daily thanks to the outstanding efforts of our faculty, staff and students as well as our leadership team. So, please check back often for more learning opportunities as they become available.
April Vacation: As noted above, it is my recommendation to cease ALL operations within the regional school district for the week of April 20th - 24th, 2020. I will be making this recommendation based upon several factors...

ul.li: First and foremost, the safety and health of everyone concerned as we enter the height of the pandemic.
Second, many of our students’ families are working harder than ever trying to maintain homes and jobs while learning how to help educate their own children.

Third, I am equally concerned that this pandemic has taxed our operational capacity and resources to the brink of exhaustion as many of our faculty and staff members have been attempting to juggle teaching and learning while helping their own children with their studies, and all while trying to maintain a household which often includes a spouse working from home.

div.p: I want to make clear that I am extremely proud of our students and their families. I am equally proud of our entire faculty, staff and administrative “Leadership” team for all their combined efforts "to keep teaching and learning alive for our entire regional school district!" I have personally “participated in” many Zoom or Google meetings. And while this in no way takes the place of what teaching and learning used to be prior to March 13th, 2020 and the closure of our regional school district, please know we miss our students very – VERY - much. In brief, we are using the time during April vacation to recharge and get ready and prepared for the final leg of this marathon.

Moreover, I have another reason to be proud of our faculty, staff, administration and students beyond the remote learning opportunities taking place within our district. Despite being advised by the MA Department of Elementary and Secondary Education - to write a “Memorandum of Agreement (MoA)” between the district and the union leadership, we have attempted to navigate this unprecedented pandemic and closure without such an agreement by keeping the lines of communication open and remaining committed to focus upon teaching and learning – together – for our students and our community! And to be clear, I am proud and pleased because our collective efforts – together - have exceeded the Remote Learning Guidelines provided by DESE; and speak to the professionalism and pride every employee takes in our work! In summary, our MoA is to continue "to communicate and adjust our sails according to the needs of our students, parents and families as best we can with what we have throughout this closure."

Right now, we know all schools and our Central Office operations will be closed throughout the month of April. No one knows if we will open in early May. I know there are lots of questions, and concerns around the topic of when we will re-open our doors again. As final decisions are made, I will keep you informed - so please stay tuned.

All schools and school-related activities in the Spencer-East Brookfield Regional School District are closed and cancelled from March 16 – May 1, 2020. The information detailed in this Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document is intended to provide guidance for this period. It is important to note that this is a fluid situation and so this document will be regularly updated and modified, and it is recommended that you revisit frequently for the latest updates and information.

Of course, a statement like the one above leads one to ask, "How do you know for sure?" Because we are sharing the “good stuff” through pictures, drawings, and letters created by our students and families. As mentioned in an earlier Superintendent Update, if families want to take pictures of their students remote learning online, I'd love to have them share! Please continue using the hashtag #SEBRSDLearnsTogether and #WeGotThis would be awesome if folks want to post pictures on twitter and use that hashtag and go ahead and loop me in @ChooseSEBRSD or my personal twitter account @pshaughey. I would love to see them and re-tweet and maybe even share on Facebook site too! Let's do what we do best - CELEBRATE THE GOOD!

I am so proud to be the Superintendent of Schools for the Spencer-East Brookfield Regional School District for so many reasons... One of the main reasons I am so proud rests with our students, our staff; and our communities; is the fact that together – “We Got This!” As always, thank you for your continued partnership and support of the Spencer-East Brookfield Regional School District!! #Progress #Unity #Knowledge
Stay safe. Stay Healthy and Stay Home.
